intro: Trichostigma octandrum f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy trichostigma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers are white to pale yellow, with four to six petals, and are often borne in terminal clusters.
